alert.note: Alert for Sherman; Valley (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 1:31AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Valley and northwestern Sherman Counties through 215 AM CDT... At 130 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Brewster to 10 miles west of Taylor to 6 miles southeast of Callaway. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fort Hartsuff State Park, Loup City and Arcadia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Persons in campgrounds at or near Sherman Reservoir should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 AM CDT for central Nebraska.
